      Wrapper method Draw a smooth cylinder capped at one end with a sphere uses a look up table for sin and cos (NB: degree not radians), arbitrary set ratio of distance and cylinder radius and detail/level

      • drawRod

        public void drawRod(float distance)
        Wrapper method Draw a smooth cylinder capped at one end with a sphere uses a look up table for sin and cos (NB: degree not radians), arbitrary set ratio of distance and cylinder radius and detail/level
        Parameters:
        distance - the length of the cylinder

      • drawRod

        public void drawRod(float distance,
                    int level)
        Wrapper method Draw a smooth cylinder capped at one end with a sphere uses a look up table for sin and cos (NB: degree not radians)
        Parameters:
        distance - the length of the cylinder
        level - detail ie inverse of level

      • drawRod

        public void drawRod(float distance,
                    float r1,
                    float r2,
                    int level)
        Real Method Draw a smooth cone section with radii r1, r2, perpendicular distance level is inverse of detail, capped with a sphere
        Specified by:
        drawRod in interface Turtle3D
        Parameters:
        distance - length of rod/truncated cone
        r1 - radius1 float
        r2 - radius2 (r1 = r2 rod) (r1 not equal r2 truncated cone/or cone?)
        level - int

      • endCap

        public void endCap(float r,
                   int detail)
        Draws a sphere cap unless radius very small
        Parameters:
        r - radius float
        detail - latitude division int
